tier.item: In `Aussie Rules' football, the code which this sentence was describing, players pass the ball to each
other by punching it with their fists.
Though of course, in practice, the commonest situation described by such predicates involves one
where the body parts are involved in both capacities, e.g. in the second case where their hands are
Evans, Gaby & Nordlinger: Compromising Transitivity: the Problem of Reciprocals
